solution_line_template: Rose cooked {initial_rice_kg} x {morning_fraction} = <<{initial_rice_kg}*{morning_fraction}={cooked_morning_kg}>>{cooked_morning_kg} kilograms of rice in the morning.
She had {initial_rice_kg} - {cooked_morning_kg} = <<{initial_rice_kg}-{cooked_morning_kg}={remaining_after_morning_kg}>>{remaining_after_morning_kg} kilogram of rice left then.

One kilogram is equal to {remaining_after_morning_kg} x {grams_per_kilogram} = <<{remaining_after_morning_kg}*{grams_per_kilogram}={remaining_after_morning_grams}>>{remaining_after_morning_grams} grams.

So, Rose cooked {remaining_after_morning_grams} x {evening_fraction} = <<{remaining_after_morning_grams}*{evening_fraction}={cooked_evening_grams}>>{cooked_evening_grams} grams of rice in the evening.

Therefore, she has {remaining_after_morning_grams} - {cooked_evening_grams} = <<{remaining_after_morning_grams}-{cooked_evening_grams}={final_remaining_grams}>>{final_remaining_grams} grams of rice left.
